title: When is URF going to be a Custom game mode like when ARAM was???????
body: When is URF going to be created into Custom game modes, back like when ARAM was a thing? When you had to make custom games to play ARAM. Why cant URF be that way??

replies.body: URF requires too much maintenance compared to ARAM, for not enough demand.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=ifyzP2Ql,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-11-03T03:48:45.255+0000)
>
> URF requires too much maintenance compared to ARAM, for not enough demand.

What maintenance.. there are PLENTY who want URF

Nowhere near as many people would play it compared to ARAM. Riot has released stats, it starts off high and drops off over a week as people get bored. Leaving it up all the time would result in it being a near-dead queue within a month.

ARAM uses exactly the same abilities and ruleset as other modes, it just has a few different items and a different map. Things dont need a lot of testing for it. Weird issues still slip through, like that issue where dashing champions moved backwards for the other team, maybe 6 months ago.

URF would require significant testing and maintenance every patch, ensuring that every bugfix or changed ability on live does not break in URF or have bizarre side-effects.

> 
> URF would require significant testing and maintenance every patch, ensuring that every bugfix or changed ability on live does not break in URF or have bizarre side-effects.

Even so if that were true, there is plenty of demand for it. There are people who actually come back to league JUST to play URF. I cannot for the life of me understand, how allowing it be a custom game mode, like ARAM was back in the day, harm anything.

I play the game from time to time when URF is not out, but I play a lot more when URF is out.   I am so glad they changed it to All Random Urf too. All Random got rid of the boring meta the formed in it.
They have to see that its 10x better than ARAM because way more people come back to play it.

>  I cannot for the life of me understand

Duly noted.
